requirement_tested: Frontend application that fetches all data from backend APIs
user_persona: A poetry enthusiast visiting the site for the first time.
user_goal: To view a list of poems without seeing any hardcoded content.

narrative_steps.title: Loading Homepage
narrative_steps.description: Sarah opens the poetry blog website and waits for the homepage to load.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the homepage URL.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The page loads dynamically, displaying a grid of poetry cards fetched from the backend API.

requirement_tested: Backend API server connecting to PostgreSQL database using provided environment variables
user_goal: To ensure the backend connects to the correct PostgreSQL database.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Backend Server
narrative_steps.description: The developer starts the backend server using the configured environment variables.
narrative_steps.action: Run `npm run dev` in the project root.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The backend successfully connects to the PostgreSQL database using DB_HOST=localhost, DB_PORT=5432, DB_USERNAME=myappuser, DB_PASSWORD=myapppassword, DB_NAME=myapp.

requirement_tested: User interface with light goldenrod layout color scheme
user_persona: A visually-oriented user appreciating design aesthetics.
user_goal: To experience a consistent light goldenrod background throughout the site.

narrative_steps.title: Browsing Site Layout
narrative_steps.description: Alex scrolls through different pages of the poetry blog, observing the overall look and feel.
narrative_steps.action: Visit multiple pages including home, search, and poem detail views.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All main layout sections consistently display a light goldenrod background as defined in the CSS stylesheet.

requirement_tested: Buttons and cards styled with olive drab color
user_persona: A detail-oriented user focused on visual consistency.
user_goal: To confirm that interactive elements use the specified olive drab color.

narrative_steps.title: Inspecting Buttons and Cards
narrative_steps.description: Jamie examines various buttons and poetry cards across the site.
narrative_steps.action: View buttons like 'Submit' and cards showing poem excerpts.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All buttons and card backgrounds are styled with the olive drab color as per the CSS classes.

requirement_tested: Poetry browsing functionality with categorized views
user_persona: A casual reader interested in exploring poetry by type.
user_goal: To browse poems filtered by category tabs.

narrative_steps.title: Viewing Category Tabs
narrative_steps.description: Taylor sees several category tabs on the homepage and wants to explore poems in one of them.
narrative_steps.action: Click on a category tab such as 'Romance'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The poetry grid updates to show only poems belonging to the selected category, fetched via /api/poems?category=:id.

requirement_tested: Search functionality for finding specific poetry content
user_persona: A user looking for a specific poem or topic.
user_goal: To find poems matching a keyword using the search bar.

narrative_steps.title: Using Search Bar
narrative_steps.description: Jordan recalls reading a poem about 'autumn' and decides to search for it.
narrative_steps.action: Type 'autumn' into the search bar and press Enter.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The page updates dynamically to show poems containing 'autumn' in their title or content, retrieved from /api/search/poems?q=autumn.

requirement_tested: User authentication system for posting poetry and commenting
user_persona: A poet wanting to share original work.
user_goal: To log in and gain access to post poetry.

narrative_steps.title: Opening Login Modal
narrative_steps.description: Casey clicks on the 'Login' link to access the authentication form.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Login' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A modal appears with fields for username/email and password, along with an olive drab submit button.

narrative_steps.title: Submitting Credentials
narrative_steps.description: Casey enters valid login information and submits the form.
narrative_steps.action: Fill in credentials and click the submit button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The system authenticates Casey and stores a JWT token, redirecting to the dashboard with a welcome message.

requirement_tested: Poetry submission form with title, content, and category fields
user_persona: An authenticated user ready to publish a new poem.
user_goal: To submit a new poem with all required details.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Submission Form
narrative_steps.description: Morgan navigates to the 'Post Poetry' section after logging in.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Post New Poem' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A form appears with fields for Title, Content, and a dropdown for selecting a Category.

narrative_steps.title: Filling and Submitting Form
narrative_steps.description: Morgan fills out the form completely and submits it.
narrative_steps.action: Enter values in all fields and click the olive drab submit button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The form data is validated and sent via POST to /api/poems, resulting in a success message or redirection to the browse view.

requirement_tested: Commenting system allowing users to comment on poetry posts
user_persona: A reader moved by a poem and eager to share thoughts.
user_goal: To leave a comment on a published poem.

narrative_steps.title: Reading a Poem
narrative_steps.description: Riley reads a touching poem and scrolls down to the comment section.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to a poem's detail page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Existing comments are displayed below the poem, and an input field is available for adding new comments.

narrative_steps.title: Adding a Comment
narrative_steps.description: Riley writes a thoughtful comment and submits it.
narrative_steps.action: Type comment content and click the olive drab 'Post Comment' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The comment is submitted via POST to /api/comments and immediately appears in the comment list.

requirement_tested: Database schema for storing poetry posts, user accounts, and comments
user_persona: A database administrator setting up the backend.
user_goal: To verify that the database schema supports all core entities.

narrative_steps.title: Checking Database Tables
narrative_steps.description: The admin inspects the database structure to ensure proper relationships exist.
narrative_steps.action: Query the database for tables: users, poems, comments, and categories.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Each table exists with appropriate columns and foreign key relationships as defined in the schema creation instructions.

requirement_tested: RESTful API endpoints for poetry CRUD operations
user_persona: A frontend developer integrating with backend services.
user_goal: To perform Create, Read, Update, and Delete actions on poems via API.

narrative_steps.title: Creating a Poem
narrative_steps.description: The developer sends a request to create a new poem entry.
narrative_steps.action: Send a POST request to /api/poems with valid poem data.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The poem is created in the database and the API returns a success response with the new poem's ID.

narrative_steps.title: Updating a Poem
narrative_steps.description: Later, the developer modifies the same poem.
narrative_steps.action: Send a PUT request to /api/poems/{id} with updated content.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The poem record is updated in the database and the API confirms the change.

requirement_tested: API endpoints for user authentication and session management
user_persona: A mobile app developer building a client for the platform.
user_goal: To authenticate users and manage sessions using the backend API.

narrative_steps.title: Registering a New User
narrative_steps.description: The developer registers a test user account.
narrative_steps.action: Send a POST request to /api/auth/register with username, email, and password.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The user is created in the database and the API returns a success response.

narrative_steps.title: Logging In
narrative_steps.description: The developer logs in the newly created user.
narrative_steps.action: Send a POST request to /api/auth/login with valid credentials.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The API responds with a JWT token used for subsequent authenticated requests.

requirement_tested: Search API endpoint with query parameters for filtering poetry
user_persona: A developer testing the search functionality.
user_goal: To validate that the search API correctly filters results.

narrative_steps.title: Searching with Query Parameters
narrative_steps.description: The developer tests the search endpoint with both keyword and category filters.
narrative_steps.action: Send a GET request to /api/search/poems?q=nature&category=uuid-here.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The API returns poems that contain 'nature' in their content and belong to the specified category.

requirement_tested: Package.json configured with 'install:all' script for frontend and backend dependencies
user_persona: A new contributor joining the project.
user_goal: To easily install all necessary dependencies for development.

narrative_steps.title: Installing Dependencies
narrative_steps.description: The contributor clones the repo and needs to set up the development environment.
narrative_steps.action: Run `npm run install:all` in the project root directory.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Both frontend and backend dependencies are installed successfully without errors.

requirement_tested: Package.json configured with 'dev' script to run frontend and backend concurrently
user_persona: A developer starting daily work on the project.
user_goal: To launch both frontend and backend servers simultaneously.

narrative_steps.title: Running Development Servers
narrative_steps.description: The developer wants to start working and needs both parts of the app running.
narrative_steps.action: Execute `npm run dev` from the project root.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Both frontend and backend servers start concurrently, allowing full-stack development and testing.
